page.title: 15A View from "Hill Top"
page.content: We stood on{Hill Top Road}looking eastwards. To our right there were houses with a{water tower}at the highest point.{Cooling towers}and a chimney on the horizon. Continuing left we see{rough grassland}and a few deciduous trees. The land then changes to{fields}used for crops and is marked out by{fences, hedges and trees.}The land rises in front of us and on the Hill Top we can see{farm buildings } almost totally surrounded bytrees and a{wood}of deciduous trees to its right. In the distance we can see {Hoober Stand.}Behind us, the{Thicks, } known by the locals as{"The 20 Acre",} divides the two{new housing estates}at Denaby and Conisbrough. In the distance we see{disused pit head gear and a{derelict power station.}Looking up hill we see the roof tops of some new houses.
